thread.title: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of October 25, 2015
thread.title_full: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of October 25, 2015

author: admin
title: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of October 25, 2015
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/25/2015 @ 1:31 PM   Rentrak 
LOS ANGELES, Oct. 25, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Rentrak (NASDAQ: RENT ), the leader in precisely measuring movies and TV everywhere, today announced the official worldwide weekend box office estimates for the weekend of Oct. 25, 2015, as compiled by the company's theatrical measurement services. 
As the trusted official standard for real-time worldwide box office reporting, Rentrak provides the only theater-level reporting in the world. Customers are able to analyze admissions and gross results around the world using Rentrak's suite of products. 
Rentrak's Senior Media Analyst Paul Dergarabedian commented, "Another out-of-this-world performance for Fox's 'The Martian' as it adds another $45.9 million this weekend and thus brings its total global tally to within striking distance of $400 million. Sony's 'Hotel Transylvania 2' also continues to be an audience favorite as it scares up another $37.7 million and $315.8 million to date across the world." 
The top 12 worldwide weekend box office estimates, listed in descending order, per data collected as of Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015, are below. 1. Martian, The - 20th Century Fox - $45.9M 2. Hotel Transylvania 2 - Sony - $37.7M 3. Paranormal Activity: Ghost Dimension - Paramount Pictures - $26.2M 4. Last Witch Hunter, The - Multiple - $24.2M 5. Ant-Man - Disney - $22.2M 6. Goosebumps - Sony - $21.3M 7. Bridge Of Spies - 20th Century Fox - $16.5M 8. Pan - Warner Bros. - $14.8M 9. Crimson Peak - Universal - $13.4M 10. Intern, The - Warner Bros. - $11.7M 11. Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials - 20th Century Fox - $8.4M 12. Shaandaar - 20th Century Fox - $8.4M 
The top 12 domestic weekend box office estimates, listed in descending order, per data collected as of Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015, are below. 1. Martian, The - 20th Century Fox - $15.9M 2. Goosebumps - Sony - $15.5M 3. Bridge Of Spies - Disney - $11.4M 4. Last Witch Hunter, The - Lionsgate - $10.8M 5. Hotel Transylvania 2 - Sony - $9.0M 6. Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension - Paramount - $8.2M 7. Steve Jobs - Universal - $7.3M 8. Crimson Peak - Universal - $5.6M 9. Intern, The - Warner Bros. - $3.9M 10. Woodlawn - Pure Flix - $3.1M 11. Sicario - Lionsgate - $3.0M 12. Pan - Warner Bros. - $2.5M 
Full details regarding the global domestic and international box office results are listed in the table below.
